text:
Question 141) In 2010, air chaos affected the European continent due to the amount of smoke expelled by a volcano in Iceland, which led to the cancellation of numerous flights.
Five days after the beginning of this chaos, the entire European airspace over 6,000 meters was released except Finland's airspace. There, only international flights over 31,000 feet were released.
Consider that 1 meter equals approximately 3.3 feet. What is the difference, in feet, between the altitudes released in Finland and the rest of the European continent five days after the beginning of chaos?
A) 3 390 feet.
B) 9 390 feet.
C) 11 200 feet.
D) 19 800 feet.
E) 50 800 feet.
